files.description: Canonical QA gate entrypoint that attempts containerized execution first and transparently falls back to a no-container failsafe mode while always writing logs and partial results to /outputs/qa.
Docker-based QA execution helper that runs the intended full QA command in a container, captures stdout/stderr and exit codes, and detects container-loss scenarios for failsafe triggering.
No-container failsafe QA runner that executes a reduced, deterministic test subset locally with strict timeouts and structured error capture to ensure logs and partial results are produced.
Utility module for creating /outputs/qa directories and writing standardized artifacts (run metadata, logs, partial results, and error reports) in a consistent schema.
Command construction and environment normalization utilities that define the canonical container and failsafe command sets and ensure deterministic behavior across modes.
Environment and failure detection helpers that identify docker availability, container runtime health, and common 'container lost' patterns to decide when to degrade gracefully.
Developer-facing documentation describing the QA gate behavior, artifacts produced, and how to extend the test sets for both container and failsafe modes.
Runbook documenting the single canonical QA gate command, expected outputs under /outputs/qa, and how to force docker or failsafe modes.
Configuration file defining default docker image/args, full test command, failsafe reduced test selection, timeouts, and artifact paths for the QA gate.

missionDescription: Create a focused remediation patch that adds a 'no-container/failsafe execution mode' to the QA runner scripts (e.g., graceful degradation, reduced test set, clear error capture) so that execution does not terminate with 'container lost' without producing logs and partial results; document the run command in /outputs/qa/RUN_INSTRUCTIONS.md.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker
Current execution repeatedly aborts before testing any files, yielding zero outputs. A failsafe mode that guarantees logs/partials is necessary to progress under unstable execution conditions.
projectName: focused remediation patch that adds a 'no-container/failsafe execution mode' to the QA runner
